page.title: 03HARLOW TRADE (HARVEY CENTRE)
page.content: Harlow's Town Centre is a pedestrian shopping area with the main shops to be found in Broad Walk.Until recently there were 163 shops in the Town Centre but in 1981 these were supplemented by the development of the Harvey Centre.This centre is completely under cover and is climatically controlled.The shops are on two levels joined by staircases and an escalator.There is an attractive seating area with a fountain,a sculpture and display area close by. People come here to relax or to meet their friends.Our survey showed that the largest and one of the most popular shops,is Tesco,whilst the smallest,an electrical shop,had only 9 sq.feet of floor space.Most of the shops were built by the Corporation and are leased to the shopkeepers. There are spaces for 3800 cars.
